WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I'm upgrading my project from .NET 3.5 to .NET 4.
One of my projects use WPFToolkit to use VisualStateManager. After changing the framework version I got error that the class VisualStateManager exist in both WpfToolkit and .NET 4.
 
I've currently resolve the problem by removing the WPF Toolkit since I only needed it for the VisualStateManager but that might be a problem in the future.
 
Are you going to release .NET 4 compatible library?
 
Thank you,
Ido.

Comments.Message: I am resorting to downgrading to 3.5 as workaround with aliasing just yields other issues now...
I just uploaded a patch that upgrades the entire solution to .NET 4.0. This includes removing redundant classes and fixing all build errors.
